description: From Middle French visibilité, from Late Latin visibilitas; equivalent to visible +‎ -ity.

entries.meaning: (countable) The degree to which things may be seen.
examples: The visibility from that angle was good.

entries.meaning: (programming) The scope within which a variable or function is able to be accessed directly.
(obsolete, rare) Something worthy of being seen; a sight.
examples: ‘Sir, I have seen all the visibilities of Paris, and around it; but to have formed an acquaintance with the people there, would have required more time than I could stay.’
